revised_title: On the Intensity of Terrestrial Magnetism and the Method for Measuring it
tldr: Professor Gauss investigates the intensity of terrestrial magnetism and proposes a new method for measuring it, which involves comparing the effects of the earth's magnetism and a magnetic needle on a second suspended needle. The method relies on the distance between the needles and the direction of their magnetic axes to determine the ratio of these forces and ultimately the intensity of the terrestrial magnetism.
